item.title: R to @slowbeef: I don't know why I said that was my favorite thing. I like it quite a bit but Monte Carlo Ray Tracing is pretty dope too
item.dc:creator: @slowbeef
item.description: I don't know why I said that was my favorite thing. I like it quite a bit but Monte Carlo Ray Tracing is pretty dope too

item.title: R to @slowbeef: If you don't what I mean, look at the purplish coin at the bottom of the QT. Basically, they want a texture that specifies new normals or bumps and someone was like "images already have 3 channels for red green blue, why not use that for XYZ?" so you get these purple normal maps.
item.dc:creator: @slowbeef
item.description: If you don't what I mean, look at the purplish coin at the bottom of the QT. Basically, they want a texture that specifies new normals or bumps and someone was like "images already have 3 channels for red green blue, why not use that for XYZ?" so you get these purple normal maps.

item.title:
My favorite trivia/tech detail is that normal maps are that color because they use RGB for XYZ - that is, they're just images but they use the color channels for the normals on the texture.
They're purplish because you're usually only modifying X and Z (which are Red and Blue)
item.dc:creator: @slowbeef
item.description:
My favorite trivia/tech detail is that normal maps are that color because they use RGB for XYZ - that is, they're just images but they use the color channels for the normals on the texture.

They're purplish because you're usually only modifying X and Z (which are Red and Blue)
